intro: Euphrasia nitidula, commonly known as the glossy woundwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine, waxy coating. Euphrasia nitidula is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
